page.title: 04Acklington Cattle Market
page.content:
{The mart}has been at Acklington for about 80 years. It is owned by a company of Alnwick Farmers (approx. 150). At present it is open 3 days a week and there are 8 full-time and between 20-30 part-time workers.
The animals get carried to the market in cattle waggons. Some come from as far away as Scotland. The railway used to be very helpful for transporting animals to the mart, but it is not used for that purpose now.
Sheep and cattle are sold every week. Prices can range from Â£5 to Â£1,000 per animal. Some of the livestock bought will end up on dinner tables all over Britain, even on the Continent.
The mart has its own canteen which is always well used by the farmers.
